result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason M Engel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution payable to Discover Card for $9,049.74; Citibank Card for $11,587.36; Barclay Mastercard for $3,730.89 and LL Bean Visa for $478.58 or civil judgment with tax intercept. Bail to be applied if applicable
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge by 04-13-2023 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable

Credit for 25 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Consecutive to: any sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason M Engel

defendant.name: Engel, Jason M
defendant.address: 8821 S. Woodcreek Dr. #5, Oak Creek, WI 53154

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.41(5)(a), a class A Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve TWENTY-FIVE (25) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for TWENTY-FIVE (25) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by BY 04-13-2023 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

* Restitution payable to DISCOVER CARD for NINE THOUSAND FORTY-NINE DOLLARS AND SEVENTY-FOUR CENTS ($9,049.74) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.
* Restitution payable to CITIBANK CARD for ELEVEN THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED EIGHTY-SEVEN DOLLARS AND THIRTY-SIX CENTS ($11,587.36) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.
* Restitution payable to BARCLAY MASTERCARD for THREE THOUSAND SEVEN HUNDRED THIRTY DOLLARS AND EIGHTY-NINE CENTS ($3,730.89) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.
* Restitution payable to LL BEAN VISA for FOUR HUNDRED SEVENTY-EIGHT DOLLARS AND FIFTY-EIGHT CENTS ($478.58) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant owes a further FIVE HUNDRED FORTY DOLLARS ($540.00) remaining towards restitution.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 12, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also appeared:  Shelly K.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  matter was staffed in Chambers.  

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden who appeared by telephone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record,  matter was staffed in Chambers.  Matter before the Court to address JusticePoint Violation.  Hearing held on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  COURT REMANDED DEFENDANT PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Matter remains scheduled for further Proceedings on 07-13-2016 at 02:30 pm.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant is eligible for admission into Drug Treatment Court.  State advised that they will be prepared as early as TOMORROW (07-06-2016).  Defense advised that Defendant has an appointment with treatment this FRIDAY (07-08-2016).  Defendant was screened for IOP.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to matter being called on the Record Court held Sidebar.  Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that the Defendant's employment is conflicting with JusticePoint monitoring.  Defense advised that Defendant needs a higher level of treatment.  Defense advised that Defendant did NOT qualify for Drug Treatment Court.  State advised that Defendant is to be re-evaluated for DTC.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  State moved for a brief adjournment.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Per DDA Altenburg.  Matter is ADJOURNED to 06-21-2016 at 01:30 pm.  sdg

JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Dated 02-23-2016.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised Matter was staffed with the DTC team.  Defendant has been prioritizing Restitution which is leading towards stressful situations and possible triggers.  Defendant was advised at staffing to focus on sobriety and not on Restitution.  Court held colloquy with Defendant.  Matter remains calendared for Review on 05-03-2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court, in custody. Attorney Andrew Golden appears on behalf of the defendant by phone. Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Chris Honecker.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  No action taken at this time.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that he has been in contact with Defendant's case manager.  Defendant has provided EIGHT HUNDRED DOLLARS ($800.00) towards restitution.  Defendant still needs to complete the letter of apology.  Defendant has completed programming.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Treatment plan.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant is in out-patient treatment at UCC.  State requests that matter be adjourned for SIXTY (60) DAYS.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is in UCC.  Per the previous hearing,  Court WAIVES Defendant's appearance due to his participation in UCC.  If Defendant is doing well in UCC his appearance may be WAIVED at the next date.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant has been in the Detoxification program since the 10-02-2015 hearing at Rogers Memorial and is on the wait list at UCC.  Defendant has provided Counsel with a $400.00 restitution payment today that Counsel will be depositing into his Trust Account today.  Defendant has been in regular contact with his attorney regarding this matter.  Based upon reasons stated today, State will not oppose a brief adjournment in order to ensure Defendant's co-operation with the Agreement.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Defedant's appearance at the next hearing is WAIVED if he is in UCC.  Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report dated 10-19-2015.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Defense reports that Defendant has not been attending JusticePoint appointments and has relapsed.  Court Orders Defendant to meet with his case worker TODAY.  Matter remains calendared for Review on 10-20-2015 at 08:30am.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court reviewed report.  Noncompliance discussed.  Defendant to make restitution payments.  Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. cmt

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant momentarily pled not guilty.

Defendant Jason M Engel in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 310 Safety Building on 5/26/15 @ 1:30 pm
